intro: Lobostemon wrightii, commonly known as Wright's lobostemon, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or swampy areas. Lobostemon wrightii is often found in the Carolinas and Georgia, where it thrives in partial to full shade.
